Даже не буду ее рекомендовать,потому что вы либо в нее играли(если нет, то вы тупой ньюфаг),либо и так знаете,что эта игра совершила переворот в игровой индустрии.Честно признаюсь мне было очень интересно играть в халву,для игры 1998 года она не просто какой то шедевр от которого у меня горел пукан все прохождение,но и достаточно качественное повествование, концовка которой дает задел на вторую часть(В которой у меня 100 часов).Вообщем, думаю вы не будете до сюда дочитывать,поэтому если дочитали,то бегом просить у мамки деньги на игру или качать с торрента.

Half-Life could have been the first FPS game I ever owned on PC as a kid. Nothing else compared at the time; the engine was well optimized and cutting edge, the level design was brilliant, the gameplay was fluid and fast paced. Overall, I think it still holds up well today.

The gameplay is very linear and mostly revolves around platforming and shooting, with some boss type encounters. The pacing is quiet good, mixing things up and offering new types of interesting environments and enemies consistently, with the exception of the lingering tram section perhaps.

Unfortunately, the part of the game that feels most dated is combat. Unlike doom 2016 for example, where each enemy requires a slightly different approach and weapon type, in Half life you sort of just throw whatever you've got at whatever is standing infront of you. Enemy behaviour is largely mindless and harder difficulty levels turn them into bullet sponges. During a recent playthrough, I was surprised to find the game offering a much stronger focus on demolition style combat than I remember, with a bounty of grenades, rockets, mines etc always at your disposal. Speaking of grenades, the physics is notably outdated and frustrating, until you learn how to use them properly (try moving forwards or backwards while throwing). The guns are a mixed bag, compared to counterstrike the more conventional pistols and automatic weapons are a bit underwhelming, especially the sound effects. However, the shotgun is good fun and so are the more experimental weapon types found in the game. It's worth noting there are plenty of MODS out there to change the game up, although I haven't experimented with them myself.

Overall, despite the negatives, this game is still good fun and obviously exceptional value for money. The pacing and variety of the levels is a key reason the game is able to consistently hold the players interest until the end.

Thousands upon thousands of reviews have already been written about the Half-Life campaign and its single-player quirks, so I am not going to go into that. However, the Half-Life multiplayer is still as fun today as it was when it first came out. You have one of the best maps for deathmatch, Crossfire, which never gets old. The number of weapons is significantly larger than you would find in modern games that offer online deathmatch-style gameplay. The responsiveness and smooth gameplay offered by the GoldSrc engine pairs well with the high-octane gameplay that is Half-Life deathmatch. 

It also runs on just about every modern or old PC, very lightweight and very easy to set-up. What's not to love?

After 21 years this game still feels like a whole new experience. It's truly amazing how such an old FPS can offer more entertainment than one of the new Call of Duty installments. I love Half Life. Everything about it is something the community loves. It is a fan favorite which changed the FPS genre to what we know now. However, is the game worth the ammount it currently sells for? Find out here:

GAMEPLAY
The gameplay is really fun and motivating. That same motivation is something you don't expirience as much in the newer FPSs which makes Half Life even better! The horror elements thrown in actually made me feel concerned for Gordon Freeman throughout the game. Some parts have the perfect ammount of horror in them yet some parts feel pretty empty making them a bit dull. Some parts get really tense, especially in the chapter 'Surface Tension' and 'Interlopers'. There is nothing to change here at least in my opinion.

DIFFICULTY
The game contains the perfect difficulty level. It is not to easy and, you can trust me, it's not forgiving either. The problem with modern action games is that I find them too straightfoward and way too easy, like they were meant for the younger audiences. I like to take on challenges and this game certianly does not dissapoint. Some parts get even too hard like the already previously mentioned 'Surface Tension' and 'Interlopers', or maybe I'm just a pleb. The American goverment did not hold back on the strenght of their soldiers. They really do exceed expectaions of difficulty with their high health and tough weapons.

ENVIRONMENT
The environments and scenery are amazing. The graphics themselves are really easy to get used to which makes the age of the game irrelevant. IMO every part of the game belongs where it is. The Xen parts are beautiful because it looks convincingly like a border between different dimensions. The space around Xen is astonishing. It is something worth staying for and enjoying.

STORY
As for the story it is really self explanatory.  SPOILERS: You step into the eyes of Gordon Freeman, a scientist (NOTE: He is not really a scientist but I call him that!) who works for Black Mesa. In a failed experiment a rift opens and the alien and human dimensions are connected. As the aliens infest the facility Gordon faces many obstacles including the most annoying one being the appearence of the American army whose objective is to terminate alien life and any other life involved with the incident, including yours. At the end a fellow scientist helps you breach into Xen, the alien world, where Gordon has a task to find and kill the source of the rifts which is the Nihilanth. SPOILER END. I like the story of the first game event though the story is more simpler, but it still does the job .

CONTROLS
The controls are the typical FPS controls we all know and love, but there is one problem. The way your character slides. It is the single most annoying feature of the entire game. It makes it feel uncontrolable and literally rage-enducing at parts. Parkouring is practically impossible when it comes to really thight jumps. You just slide off unless you hold shift and control after making the jump, just like minecraft. This is probabbly the only feature that I don't particularly like. I know this is less of a problem to other people, but I'm used to having my character stop after letting go of the 'W' key. Maybe it's just me, but I think this is a problem, but there's no point in complaining since it's not getting fixed considering this is a 21 year old classic now.

PRICE
The normal price is 8,19 euro or dollars. Is it worth that though? I would say probably not. The game is amazing and i totally recommend buying it and supporting the developers, but I would personally wait for a sale. On a sale it costs less than 2 euro/dollars which is totally worth it. If you encounter a sale and see this game I encourage you to pick it up if you like great Sci-Fi/Action games!

Half-Life ist ein Action-FPS, der am 8. November 1998 von Valve auf den Markt gebracht wurde. Die gleichnamigen Entwickler haben hier einen wahrhaft unglaublichen Klassiker erschaffen, doch, ist es auch dem "Klassiker"-Titel gerecht? Das Spiel kostet im Vollpreis 8,19€.

Vorab möchte ich dem Spiel schon mal einen Pluspunkt geben, weil es trotz des Alters von nun 20 Jahren immer noch funktioniert, ohne eine Mod installieren zu müssen.

[b] Umfang [/b]
Das Spiel bietet eine mehr oder weniger umfangreiche Story, in der man durch einen Unfall die Welt, bzw. sogar das Universum retten muss. Dabei bekämpft man unterschiedliche Monster und später sogar noch das Militär, welches sich ursprünglich als Hilfe erweisen sollte. 

Zwischendurch muss man auch mal einen Miniboss töten oder kleinere Rätsel lösen. Die Rätsel sind meistens nicht sehr schwierig, sind aber eine gute Abwechslung zum Kämpfen.

Das Kämpfen und Abmetzeln der Monster und des Militärs macht unheimlich viel Spaß und manchmal ist auch ein wenig Geschick gefragt. Durch die Wahl der drei unterschiedlichen Schwierigkeitsstufen kann man sogar wählen, wie schwer oder wie leicht man es haben will. Ich habe das Spiel auf der Schwierigkeitsstufe "normal" gespielt und muss sagen, dass es wirklich gut darauf angepasst war.

Die Größe der unterschiedlichen Welten war natürlich minimiert, da Half-Life keineswegs ein Open-World-Spiel ist. Es sind vielmehr einzelne Level, die man mit seinem Können meistern muss.

Ich habe für Half-Life gute 10 Stunden gebraucht, um es durchzuspielen. Andere sind vielleicht noch langsamer, die meisten schaffen es denke ich aber schneller. Die Länge ist ganz OK, zudem man sich auch noch im Multiplayer-Modus oder im Trainingsraum vergnügen kann.

[b] Grafik [/b]
Das Spiel ist aus den relativ späten 90ern und deshalb kann man grafisch nichts außergewöhnliches erwarten. Trotz des Alters ist die Grafik erstaunlich gut. Die Umgebung ist wirklich schön auf das eigene Level angepasst und die Effekte, seien es die Partikel bei den Monstern oder Blutflecken, sehen wirklich nicht schlecht aus. 

Die Gestaltung der Monster ist auch sehr schön und ich war vor allem beeindruckt, als sogar der Getränkeautomat funktionierte (nur leider konnte man daraus nichts trinken)

Das Interface war schön geordnet und minimalistisch gehalten und der Schadenssensor war auch so gut wie immer richtig.

[b] Spielspaß [/b]
Half-Life hat mich in den ersten 30 Minuten nicht wirklich gefesselt, aber als man richtig in die Story reinkram, hatte ich so eine Art Verlangen, das Spiel immer weiterzuspielen. Es hat wirklich unheimlich viel Spaß gemacht. Die Kämpfe, vor allem gegen das Militär, waren spannend und nicht immer einfach, was natürlich gut gemeint ist. Ein Spiel ist auch langweilig, wenn es zu einfach ist.

Es war außerdem sehr lustig, als ich mich manchmal erschrocken habe, weil ein Alien mich von hinten ansprang und sich die Leute im TS kaputtgelacht haben. Dabei hab ich nicht mal geschrien, aber es war trotzdem sehr sehr lustig.

Die Rätsel in dem Spiel sind, wie schon oben geschrieben, mehr oder weniger leicht, werten aber den Spaßfaktor durch die Abwechslung auf. 

Was meiner Meinung nach ein wenig den Spaß nimmt, ist die Steuerung. Klar kann man bei einem Spiel aus den 90ern keine Top-Steuerung erwarten, aber manchmal war es schon nervig, als z.B. der "Supersprung" in der letzten Welt nicht immer funktionierte und buggte.

[b] Musik [/b]
Wahrscheinlich ist vielen, die CS:GO oder allgemein CS spielen, aufgefallen, dass einige Musikstücke aus Half-Life in den besagten Spielen vorkommen. Ich persönlich liebe diese Musik. Es ist nur schade, dass die Musik nicht dauerhaft lief, was aber durch die große Anzahl an SFX überblendet wurde.

[b] Sound [/b]
Wie gerade eben schon angesprochen gab es eine Vielzahl an SFX, die vor allem auch in Garry's Mod und anderen Valve-Spielen vorkommen. Ich finde es auch sehr toll, dass auf eine große Zahl von Umgebungsgeräuschen geachtet wurde, um das Spiel so authentisch wie möglich zu machen.

Aber ich muss auch hier ein paar Abstriche bei den Dialogen machen. Die Stimmen hatten oft ein teilweise sogar grobes Rauschen im Hintergrund. Ich denke schon, dass es 1998 bessere Mikrofone gab, mit denen das hätte verhindert werden können. Ich will hier aber gar nicht groß rumnörgeln, denn die Dialoge waren trotzdem verständlich. Sollte ich mich bezüglich der Mikrofontechnologie irren, so gebt mir bitte bescheid! :D

[b] Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis [/b]
Man bekommt für 8,19€ im VP eine ca. 10-stündige Story, die in mehreren Schwierigkeitsstufen gespielt werden kann. Zudem gibt es einen Multiplayer-Modus und einen Trainingsraum. Im großen Ganzen ist das Spiel die 8,19€ wert.

[b] Fazit [/b]
Half-Life ist es auf jeden Fall wert den "Klassiker"-Titel zu tragen. Ein Muss für jeden, der alte Spiele liebt. Meiner Meinung nach sollte jeder Half-Life einmal gespielt oder wenigstens gesehen haben.

[b] Fazitfazit [/b]
Umfang: 8/10
Grafik: 9/10
Spielspaß: 8/10
Musik: 10/10
Sound: 7/10
Preis-Leistung: 9,5/10
+1 Bonus

Endwertung: 89/100

I cannot begin to express the unimaginable impact this game had on me when i was young. The first time i fought the HECU marines was a truly terrifying experience. I remember never seeing anything like it before and being dumbstruck at just how fast they dominated me. I love this game. There is a feeling that permeates throughout black mesa and its surrounding area for me. Its a feeling of thrift shop pcs and ball mice. Lan party's, late nights and Doritos. The story is so well done, it is one of the only game series that presents such unbelievable things but due to tone, pacing, and world building manages to make them believable and the game design contemporary no matter what year you dust off this classic in. If you have never played this, then please do so. You deserve the chance to understand why so many half life fanboys look at new valve with a sort of distant attachment and contempt. I love you Gabe, please go talk to Marc and finish what you started those ages ago in the test chamber. Please?

[h1]Details[/h1]
[quote]
[h1]The path to Xen: still amazing 20 years on...[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1607036225
What can be said about a very old game? Well [url=https://www.moddb.com/mods/half-life-echoes] Echoes [/url] is what brought me back and I thoroughly enjoyed another take on the mutli-threaded universe.  [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/Black_Mesa/] Black Mesa [/url] is a great full remake, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/225840/Sven_Coop/] Sven Co-Op [/url] is a great team-based remake.
...and of course the many sequels, and the infamous missing final chapter.
Seriously, it's a 20-year-old classic that everyone should own and play, it is still supported by the fans and loved by the critics!
[/quote]
[h1]Summary[/h1]
[quote]
[h1]The perfect experiment (we do not question the G-man).[/h1]
Pros: 
- it still stands up as a strong, challenging game
- the writing, characters, pacing and humour really flesh-out this tongue-in-cheek sci-fi nightmare
- there is so much love for this grand-daddy of FPS survival games
- strong AI and a palpable sense of fear
- new mods, like the excellent 'Echoes', breath life into this wonderful universe

Cons:
- an engine even older than Fallout 76's one (though inifinitely more reliable)
- the graphics do creak a bit - but hey, 'Black Mesa' is worthy of a look too.
- the story will never end... (well, until Todd Howard buys the franchise).
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1748254368
[/quote]

Half-life, the game that took the world by storm and became one of the biggest phenomena in the gaming world and then turned into a meme and just died off. Everything started with this game, I played this game after 20 years of its initial release. I was never into the half-life band wagon, since i started my gaming venture roughly 11 years after this games release. I always wondered what is all the fuss about. Being played now I can safely say that "Well how did I missed it for this long time".
As you might have assumed already the game holds up pretty well (for the most part at least). The game has popularized many of the troupes that are can be seen even today like the in engine cut scenes where you have the full control of your character.
The experience with the game started very sorely to say the least. The very first scene where Gordon is in the tram and the voice that tell the all the usual things about safety and the tram moves slowly to the destination was not as punching as I thought. It was touted as one of the most famous opening scenes in the whole gaming history. But for me it was just another opening scene with ugly textures and blocky character models. I was just disappointed but kept up with it. Well the best decision made in a long while. After an hour or so into the game something just clicked with me (the story of course). I was going through all the rooms, listening to all the characters, killing all the Headcrabs, zombies, bullsquids, barnacle tongues and vortigaunts, squashing all the boxes, ignoring all the ugly textures and blocky character models. I was hooked. I have to say, if you are like me means started gaming in the call of duty era then you might be as spoiled as me by the constant spoon feeding of the objectives, map markers and radars you’ll find this game too confusing as there are no radars or mini maps or not even the objectives. I looked up some guides online and just kept going, till the very end
The gameplay is very standard you move from point a to b by solving some environment puzzles and killing enemies. There are wide verities of enemies to kill. All kind of aliens and then the zombies and the marines. The game has all the standard weapons like knife, pistols, shotgun, sub machines guns and few types of explosives. There are some unusual one like the gauss gun and gluon gun etc. The official expansion opposing force added some more weapons to the mix.
But there are some things that I didn’t like about the game. Mainly the movement. In felt like the whole black mesa facility floors were covered in grease. You can’t move accurately. It always felt off like I am skiing. It was the main gripe for me during the puzzles where you need to jump from one moving ledge to other and little bit of over movement will drop you to your death. The second thing that I hated are the puzzles itself they were not well explained and felt tedious. I found myself constantly searching for the guides. 
The game has a fairly good checkpoint system and I never found myself repeating more than 5 mins of the game because I died or messed up.
The 2 official expansion packs the “opposing force” and “blue shift” are really good as well they add another 10 or so hours to the game, and if you are like me and want to squeeze every bit of the story from the half-life then these expansions are really worth it. Over all if you call yourself a gamer and never played this game then you are lying to yourself. Listen to me you never played this game (that’s extremely unlikely, but still) just get it and the expansions as well. I just hope that valve get its act together and start producing these masterpieces again.

zostałą zamknięta. Valve, kiedy nauczycie się liczyć do trzech? W każdym razie - Gra jeszcze z poprzedniego
milenium nadal jest dobrze grywalna. To ona dała początek takim grom jak Counter-Strike czy Team Forttress 2.
Nie opowiada ona o superbohaterze, który ma za zadanie ocalić cały wszechświat, lecz o naukowcu, który znalazł
się w nie odpowiednim miejscu i czasie, który z początku ma za zadanie jedynie uciec, dzierżąc w ręce
jedynie łom. Wraz z biegiem fabuły walczymy z kosmitami, oraz wojskiem, dzierżąc coraz to lepsze uzbrojenie. 
I tak od zardzewiałego łomu możemy dotrzeć do nowiuśkiej rakietniy, czy do prototypowej broni laserowej. 
Jeżeli zaś chodzi o serwery, bo tak, pierwsza odsłona half-lifa miała możliwość gry w multi, to te serwery są
nadal ełne. Może nie wszystkie, ale patrząc na to, ile ta gra ma lat, można stwierdzić, że nadal gra w nią 
całkiem sporo osób.
这是童年经典！！！上车补票再来一次！！！

개인적 취향에 꼭 맞지는 않았지만 전설의 명작 재미있게 잘 했습니다. 작품은 그 시대와 함께 한다는 말에 크게 공감합니다. 20년 전에 했더라면 감회가 또 달랐겠지요. 또 다른 전설로 남으며 끝없이 고통받는 한국 성우의 명 연기도 잘 감상했습니다.

得益于我这破旧的小笔记本，画面稍微牛逼一点的游戏都玩不了，于是我把目光转向了经典旧作。

其实我的目标是HL2，不过既然要玩2，当然要先玩1，于是我就怀着激动的心情打开了这个20年前的神作。

先说缺点：
移动的感觉极其的滑，稍有不慎就滑过头了。可能是我菜，但是所有移动的关卡，比如跳台子啊，跳柱子啊，跳箱子啊，我基本都跳了10遍以上。
画面的话，毕竟20年前的游戏，无所谓了，反正我也不是画面党。

优点就很多了：
剧情：真的很有趣，虽然比较单调的不停在黑山基地移动，最后在跑到xen上来个斩首行动。不过流程里还是蛮有趣的，从一脸懵逼的清理外星生物，到轻车熟路的清理外星生物，再到一脸懵逼的清楚美军，再到轻车熟路的清除美军，最后旁观美军大战外星人再轻车熟路的清楚剩下的那边。唯一有点可惜的是xen上流程太短了，印象深刻的只有巨大的触手和巨难清理干净的工厂（当然还有巨丑的最终boss）。
再次还有怀念一下陪我战斗（送死？）的保安们和科学家们。

关卡设计：很优秀，很吸引人，让人一直有玩下去的欲望。

综合来看，不是画面党的话，绝对可以玩一下，很有趣。

多的不说了，我去玩HL2了。

It was my first played game and I love it. This game makes me remember those old times when I sat with my father in cold winter and experienced this masterpiece together. Especially worth replaying the game!
